The Chronocyclegraph was developed by Frank Gilbreth and his wife, Lillian in the early 20th century. The couple employed small lamps on worker's hands and time-lapse photography to reduce a work cycle to the most efficient sequence. Gilbreth was the first to propose that a nurse could assist the surgeon, by handing them surgical instruments. He also devised the techniques used to teach how to rapidly disassemble and reassemble weapons.

title: Double Dosing Levonorgestrel-Based Emergency Contraception for Individuals With Obesity: A Randomized Controlled Trial - PubMed

last_post.content: This was disappointing. Lower efficacy of Plan B (levonogestrel) in people with larger bodies can’t be overcome with a higher dose. This study found doubling the dose had no impact on preventing ovulation. Ella (ulipristal acetate) remains the best option for these folks (and everyone really) but unfortunately requires a prescription. #MedMastodon https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/35849455/

title: Suzanne Simard: Mother Trees and the Social Forest - The Long Now

last_post.content:
Suzanne Simard has started a 100-year project to help the social forest (aka "tree neighborhoods") migrate north -- across the clear-cut landscape we've created -- so it can flourish in the subarctic as things warm up and provide ecosystem services including carbon sequestration, water capture, and fire resilience.

Don't miss the part about bears, and then native people, depositing salmon carcasses at the base of mother trees to feed the forest. ❤️

https://longnow.org/seminars/02021/jun/15/mother-trees-and-social-forest/

A map for code

In this video, I start up in quick succession:

* a simple test app
* the 'driver' programming environment showing the map for the app's code
* the 'meta-driver' programming environment showing the map for the driver's code

On initial load the driver (glitchily) zooms out over the whole codebase before zooming back in to the previous session.

https://codeberg.org/akkartik/driver.love

(Inspiration: early side-scrolling videogames that would often start a new level by panning across all of it.)

title: Notes from a data witch - Everything I know about Mastodon

last_post.content:
@NicoleCRust field-specific hashtags for paper announcements and threads might not work so well for those of us with poor memories and interests across multiple fields, because we would have to remember the specific hashtags for each field.

The Mastodon advanced web interface allows you to follow combinations of hashtags (instructions here: https://blog.djnavarro.net/posts/2022-11-03_what-i-know-about-mastodon/#tracking-hashtags) but it doesn't appear to allow for (#neuroscience AND (#NewPaper OR #PaperThread)), plus I think I found a bug.

For now, I think I will follow (#PaperThread OR #NewPaper OR #NeuroPaperThread OR #NeuroNewPaper OR ...).

Plus, I'm copying in @cogsci #CogSci and #CompCogSci because this is an issue that needs to be discussed in all research communities.
